abstractContent.text: The 2017 edition of *SEM, the 6th in the annual series, took on as its theme "representations of meaning", an area of acute interest in the field for the past several years.

The conference program shows that this year's *SEM has been especially successful in covering its theme from abroad range of perspectives, including various flavors of distributional, lexical, and formal/linguistic semantics.
Thus, the 2017 conference meets the overall goal of the *SEM series, by bridging across relatively independent communities approaching the computational modeling of semantics from different angles.

Hopefully, the diversity of the program will provide not only something of interest to abroad audience of NLP researchers, but also serve to stimulate new ideas and synergies that can significantly impact the field.
